name: Stocked Up Safehouse
description: Make the Safehouse's hidden chest items respawn. Add more items around the safehouse.

options.name: Playing Online
options.tooltip: Enable this for item changes to take effect when playing online. If you enable this and use the Peacock server, you need to also install https://github.com/thepeacockproject/peacock-strings for Peacock’s text to display properly.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING! You can still collect the Silverballer the first time. It just won't respawn.

options.name: Silverballer
options.tooltip: The Silverballer now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: Floralballer
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Silverballer the first time, the Floralballer now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed. Good if you're using the Comfy Safehouse Expansion.

options.name: Goldballer
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Silverballer the first time, the real Goldballer now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed. Good if you're using the Comfy Safehouse Expansion.

options.name: Pyriteballer
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Silverballer the first time, the original Freelancer version of the Goldballer now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed. Good if you have the default safehouse armory and the Freelancer Goldballer Fix.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING! You can still collect the Fiber Wire the first time. It just won't respawn.

options.name: Fiber Wire
options.tooltip: The Fiber Wire now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: Fiber Wire Classic
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Fiber Wire the first time, the Fiber Wire Classic now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING! You can still collect the Merces reward the first time. It just won't respawn.

options.name: Classic Coin
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Merces reward the first time, a Classic Coin now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed. Gear Capacity is 1 and Rarity is Epic.

options.name: Outstanding Service Coin
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Merces reward the first time, the ICA Outstanding Service Coin now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: 1K Merces
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Merces reward the first time, about 1,000 Merces reward now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: 10K Merces
options.tooltip: After you've collected the Merces reward the first time, a 10,000 Merces reward now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: 30K Merces
options.tooltip: The original 30,000 Merces reward now respawns in the chest hidden behind the Safehouse shed.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING!
Adds the Squeaky Toy kiwi to the basement bathroom. Gear Capacity is 2.
Adds the Squeaky Toy kiwi to the basement bathroom. Gear Capacity is 1.
Adds the Squeaky Toy kiwi to the basement bathroom. Gear Capacity is 0 for cheaters.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING!
Adds the Red Tie Kiwi in the basement near the exit ladder. Gear Capacity is 2.
Adds the Red Tie Kiwi in the basement near the exit ladder. Gear Capacity is 1.
Adds the Red Tie Kiwi in the basement near the exit ladder. Gear Capacity is 0 for cheaters.

options.name: Garageː Fuse Cell
options.tooltip: Add a second fuse cell if the first one is already in use. Because at this point, 47 can afford to buy a second fuse. Plus it's dangerous to build bombs in the dark. If you've just plugged in the first fuse, exit the safehouse and re-enter for the spare to appear.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING!
Add a propane flask in the garage starting at Mastery Level 8. As soon as the garage is accessible. Gear Capacity is 4.
Add a propane flask in the garage starting at Mastery Level 20. Gear Capacity is 4.
Add a propane flask in the garage starting at Mastery Level 42. Gear Capacity is 4.
Add a propane flask in the garage starting at Mastery Level 64. As soon as the explosives crafting table is accessible. Gear Capacity is 4.
Add a propane flask in the garage starting at Mastery Level 87. Gear Capacity is 4.
Add a propane flask in the garage starting at Mastery Level 100. Another reward for completing the grind. Gear Capacity is 4.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING!
Add a small pumpkin in the garden by the kitchen. Gear Capacity is 2 and has no rarity.
Add a small pumpkin in the garden by the kitchen. Gear Capacity is 1 and has no rarity.
Cheater, cheater, pumpkin eater. Add a small pumpkin in the garden by the kitchen. Gear Capacity is 0 and has no rarity.

options.name: Common
options.tooltip: Add a small pumpkin in the garden by the kitchen. Gear Capacity is 2 and has Common rarity. Included so the pumpkin stays in 47's inventory between missions.

options.name: Rare
options.tooltip: Add a small pumpkin in the garden by the kitchen. Gear Capacity is 1 and has Rare rarity.

options.name: Off
options.tooltip: You get... NOTHING!
Add emetic, lethal, and sedative vials to the infirmary. Gear Capacity is 2 to match the vials in the Tool crate. They will begin appearing at Mastery Level 11.
Add emetic, lethal, and sedative vials to the infirmary. Gear Capacity is 1 to match the pills in the Tool crate. They will begin appearing at Mastery Level 11.
Add emetic, lethal, and sedative vials to the infirmary. Gear Capacity is still 0 to be a cheater. They will begin appearing at Mastery Level 11.

options.name: Kitchenː Knife
options.tooltip: Add a kitchen knife on the kitchen counter. Gear Capacity is 3 to match the Grape Knife.

options.name: Kitchenː Muffin
options.tooltip: Add a blueberry muffin on the kitchen counter. Gear Capacity is 1.
